articles.headline: Market Shock: AAA Rating May Be Junk
articles.snippet: The question is whether the market can continue rising as investors learn that the financial innovations that helped to build the boom were constructed on sand.
articles.abstract: The question is whether the market can continue rising as investors learn that the financial innovations that helped to build the boom were constructed on sand.
articles.lead_paragraph: The great stock market rally of 2002 through 2007 has been built on liquidity — and much of the liquidity has been based on financial engineering that allowed highly risky investments to be financed by investors who thought they were taking no risks.

articles.headline: Dow Caps a 4-Month Surge, Closing Above 14,000
articles.snippet: Driven by corporate buyouts, strong profit reports and stock buybacks, the market closed at a record high.
articles.abstract: Driven by corporate buyouts, strong profit reports and stock buybacks, the market closed at a record high.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Dow Jones industrial average closed just over 14,000 yesterday for the first time, capping a four-month rally that has been driven by corporate buyouts, strong corporate profits and companies buying back their own shares.

articles.headline: Job-Hopping, or, Hello, He Must Be Going
articles.snippet: Michael D. Capellas is emblematic of a new breed of mercenary manager who perform quick resuscitations on floundering companies before moving on to the next job.
articles.abstract: Michael D. Capellas is emblematic of a new breed of mercenary manager who perform quick resuscitations on floundering companies before moving on to the next job.
articles.lead_paragraph: Time was when serial job-hopping was a stain on a corporate résumé. Michael D. Capellas has turned it into a career.

articles.headline: Family Feud at CBS and Viacom
articles.snippet: A growing rift between Sumner N. Redstone, the media billionaire, and his daughter Shari has called into question who will inherit control of the Viacom empire.
articles.abstract: A growing rift between Sumner N. Redstone, the media billionaire, and his daughter Shari has called into question who will inherit control of the Viacom empire.
articles.lead_paragraph: In recent years, the media billionaire Sumner M. Redstone has had high-profile blow-ups with everyone from top executives who worked for him to the Hollywood superstar Tom Cruise and his only son, Brent.
articles.byline: By Richard Siklos and Geraldine Fabrikant

articles.headline: Women Supportive but Skeptical of Clinton, Poll Says
articles.snippet: The senator faces skepticism among older women and those who are married especially, according to the latest Times/CBS News poll.
articles.abstract: The senator faces skepticism among older women and those who are married especially, according to the latest Times/CBS News poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: Women view Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton more favorably than men do, but she still faces skepticism among some women, especially those who are older and those who are married, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye and Dalia Sussman

articles.headline: Alliances Shift as Turks Weigh a Political Turn
articles.snippet: Liberal Turks are pledging votes to religious politicians as well as a new array of independents in Sunday’s election.
articles.abstract: Liberal Turks are pledging votes to religious politicians as well as a new array of independents in Sunday’s election.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL, July 19 — For 84 years, modern Turkey has been defined by a holy trinity — the army, the republic and its founder, Mustafa Kemal Ataturk. Each was linked inextricably to the others and all were beyond reproach.

articles.headline: Google Earnings Up 28% but Miss Expectations
articles.snippet: The search giant’s shares declined sharply in after-hours trading despite its 58 percent increase in quarterly revenues.
articles.abstract: The search giant’s shares declined sharply in after-hours trading despite its 58 percent increase in quarterly revenues.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 19 — Sometimes what is good enough for Google is not good enough for Wall Street.
